intro: Mikaniopsis cissampelina, commonly known as the creeping spurge, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions. It is a member of the Euphorbiaceae family and is characterized by its succulent, often hairy stems and leaves. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically greenish-yellow in color. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in disturbed areas or along roadsides. Due to its rapid growth, it can become invasive in certain environments.
